lead_paragraph: As a college student spending summers working tobacco fields, King tasted life without segregation and began to choose a career path.

headline.print_headline: King in Connecticut: Closer to a Promised Land
headline.main: Martin Luther King in Connecticut: Closer to a Promised Land

snippet: As a college student spending summers working tobacco fields, King tasted life without segregation and began to choose a career path.
abstract: Simsbury, Conn, historians describe with pride period during 1940s when young Dr Martin Luther King, Jr worked there as tobacco harvester, one of many students recruited from top black colleges for summer employment by area farms; King credited working there as reason for entering clergy but fact was little known until 2011 Simsbury High School film project released documentary about King's time living in town; memorial honoring civil rights leader is planned for grounds of Simsbury Historical Society (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
